content: The Battle of Waterloo, which marked the end of Napoleon Bonaparte's rule as Emperor of the French, took place in what year?

The Battle of Waterloo took place in 1815. It was fought on June 18 near Waterloo in present-day Belgium, then part of the United Kingdom of the Netherlands. The battle pitted the French Army, led by Napoleon Bonaparte, against the Allied armies, consisting of Dutch, Prussian, British, Hanoverian, and Brunswick forces, commanded by the Duke of Wellington and Field Marshal Blücher. This decisive battle resulted in Napoleon's defeat and led to his abdication and exile, effectively ending his reign as Emperor of the French.
